file_content.text: You made it through. Did the Republic have any information about Guardian Hold Four?
Bad news.
Guardian Hold Four is far worse than the last one. I hope you're ready to hear this.
Guardian Hold Four used to be a small manor called Bakvalen Hall. Now it's bristling with defenses; turrets, force fields...
But after someone betrayed Guardian Hold Four from the inside, it's all protecting the enemy.
If the betrayer is another Child of the Emperor, capturing them might give us a way to the First Son.
That traitor may be the key.
As the First Son watches the sky, we strike from the earth.
We can't break the Imperial lines without removing their fallback position. So first, we retake Guardian Hold Four.
We need the Hold back.
I was hoping the First Son was here. Without him we could end this quickly.
Has anyone seen the First Son?
This traitor, who shed their cloak of lies; when caged, they will whisper of the First Son.
The Republic gave us information on Guardian Hold Four's defenses. They're... serious.
First, the hold has an early warning system. Sensors across the park report any approaching enemies.
Then, a force field protects the courtyard. And past that, the main door is durasteel, locked with a full security system.
So we have sensors to disable, a force field to take down, and a main door to unlock.
Three problems to solve.
Unless we get rid of those sensors in the park, we won't get close enough to address the force field or the locked door.
The sensors come first.
Early warning sensors, force fields, secure doors--Master Syo certainly knew how to build a Guardian Hold.
That's a lot of defenses.
That force field is a major problem. I can't think of any way past it.
Jedi. You destroy the sensors. Imperials will drop the force field to investigate.
A surprise attack then would take our armies past the force field.
Which gets us inside.
Have you foreseen the Imperials will do this?
Is that from a vision?
Not seeing. Knowing.
Once the sensors are destroyed, a surprise attack would put our people past the force field.
When the Imperials go to investigate, our forces destroy them and get past the force field.
That's when we pounce.
So we need, say, a "Red Team" to ambush the Imperials that come out after the force field is lowered.
Red Team must be strong. Imperials will fight hard.
I'd welcome any insights you have.
Any suggestions, Gaden-Ko?
Send commandos.
The Voss commandos would be fine for this Red Team.
We need fearless warriors.
They will fight well.
That leaves the main door. With the force field down, we can get to the power generators; we disable them, the big door unlocks.
We should assign a "Blue Team" to disable those generators. A very small group would work.
Your droids would make short work of security.
Let me think....
We can spare a couple.
Teams will need your help later. Blue Team, protection as they work. Red Team, battle support.
We have a plan. Once you destroy the sensors, go to Guardian Hold Four to help your team. Are you ready?
I am. And may the Force be with us.
Yes.
Please recap the plan first.
You destroy the sensors around Axial Park, to draw out the Imperials and get them to drop their force field. We'll get two teams to rush in.
When the generators are down, and the main door unlocks, go inside, and find our traitor.
It'll be quite the adventure.
The traitor's light will illuminate the First Son's path. We breathe upon his neck.
Jedi! Long time no see. Captain Valon, reporting in. First Hoth, now Corellia. You stay busy.
I'm conducting an urgent mission. Please get to the point.
Yes, so talk quickly.
Unfortunately, I've seen many faces since we last spoke.
I don't remember you.
Killed any more Republic soldiers lately, Valon?
Gee, Lieutenant. And I even brought a gift.
You hunt a man across Hoth, break his armor, bind him with an oath, and don't remember it?
Doesn't matter, I always keep my word. I rounded up enough men and ships to give the Imperials a dent. Once.
Hopefully, this is about the men you were recruiting for me.
You agreed to get me troops.
Good! Right to business.
I'm a man of my word, Jedi. I got you enough men and ships to put a serious dent in the Imperials. Once.
After that, we'll have to scatter, before they send trigger-happy capital ships to chase us. So, any Imperials getting you down?
We're about to assault a fortress in Axial Park. It has turrets and enemy soldiers in the courtyard.
Yes. Attack the Guardian Hold.
Nice. We can do a bombing run on those turrets before your guys move in.
I may have greater need of you later.
Syo might flee Corellia....
We can stay in our nice, cozy orbit until you call.
Just don't get any funny ideas. We know a prison world with a few stasis chambers sitting empty.
Thanks, but I tried immortality already. I got my orders. Valon signing off.
Don't give a step. Valon signing off.
I never thought the Imperials would make it this far. Not to the Core Worlds, not Corellia.
Master Syo's briefings on the Corellian situation are grim. Treachery, Imperials invading, a resistance under fire--I saw it all back home.
Did someone on Corellia betray us?
You said "treachery"?
Apparently, the Empire made Corellia's backstabbing government an offer.
Not to mention, we have Nadia to find.
And Nadia's down there.
Don't forget about Felix.
And Felix is down there.
We know the automated landing system put the escape pod in Coronet City's shipyards. It's a start. But we have a war to fight, too.
You can't compare Corellia to what happened on your world.
Focus. This isn't Balmorra.
The Empire's using different words, but I know the song.
There is good news. Master Syo completed work on the Guardian Holds before the invasion began.
What are these Guardian Holds?
Guardian Holds?
Ah, of course. Master Syo only just passed on this briefing.
I should have guessed Master Syo had made preparations.
Master Syo always plans ahead.
If there's something new in our battle plan, I should have been told.
No one mentioned this.
The Guardian Holds are buildings across Coronet City, Corellia's capital. Factories, bunkers, munition stores--everything you'd need to conquer a city.
Master Syo's fortified each of those buildings with special defenses, and code-named them Guardian Holds.
The Guardian Holds mean we have several impenetrable fortresses, from which we can always retake Coronet City. Even if it falls to the Empire.
With those Guardian Holds, and our military assets protected, we can concentrate on offense.
And that frees us to fight.
That's the idea.
Such critical positions would need to be defended at all costs.
How secure are these Holds?
The Guardian Hold fortifications are pretty impregnable--with elite Republic troops stationed inside each one.
Let's focus on winning, rather than how we'll claw our way back if we lose.
That's rather defeatist.
Defending the Guardian Holds does make the Republic a little shorthanded, though, which is where our armies come in.
Landing armies takes time. Should search shipyards for little Nadia, before Empire finds.
The Force will aid me.
Takes time to land armies. Should search shipyards for missing lieutenant, before Empire finds.
Coronet City's shipyards are enormous. I won't find the escape pod without help.
I need a solid lead first.
We did pick up a few emergency broadcasts from Coronet City. There was one that.... Here.
I have the Force to guide me.
What if you vanish too? We need a practical backup plan.
Have someone else look. I need to focus on leading our forces.
I should delegate this.
Information recovered from dreadnaught is critical. We coordinate; you are best to search.
What about the emergency broadcasts? I think there was one... yes, here.
...repeat, this is Captain Drizan, calling any defenders near the Coronet shipyards. The Imperials overran Zone Twelve. Calling for emergency assistance!
We could search the shipyards while we defend them. Tell Captain Drizan we're on our way.
Maybe we can help each other.
At once, Jedi.
If Captain Drizan knows the shipyards, he may know where our escape pod went.
This man can guide us.
I'll let him know you're coming.
Perhaps our pod didn't land in the shipyards; this "Captain Drizan" didn't mention it.
No word of an escape pod.
The man sounds preoccupied, Jedi. The shipyards are our best lead.
So. Droids from Balmorra, the Esh-kha, Voss commandos, and whatever pirate dregs Captain Valon has scraped together.
Tai's droids, Esh-kha, commandos. We land all.
Now we find out if they're enough to save the Republic.
We'd stand the best chance with an Esh-kha Red Team.
The Esh-kha can be Red Team.
We are still raw. Others must bear the steel and fire.
The Balmorran droids can handle the ambush, then.
Send the droids instead.
In that case, let the commandos carry it.
Substitute the Voss commandos.
The shadows will grow teeth for this Empire.
Your droids would be ideal for Red Team's duties.
Make the Red Team all droids.
No, there's not enough units left after the last set-to. What about the others?
In that case, the Esh-kha would be best.
Let's send the Esh-kha.
Who would be the best alternative?
Suggestions, Gaden-Ko?
Esh-kha should go.
All right. Let's use Gaden-Ko's commandos.
The Voss commandos, then.
All right, I'll send the order.
They still recover. Others must go.
Very well. Send the Esh-kha, instead.
Make it the Esh-kha.
Search your feelings, who should go instead?
Who would you send?
Send Esh-kha.
Tai's droids would be a fair substitute.
Let's send the droids.
Rendezvous at Guardian Hold Four, and defend Blue Team while they disable the generators.
Rendezvous at Guardian Hold Four, and help Red Team fight the Imperials until the generators are disabled.
Maybe they can patch up a few of the damaged ones.
Hallow Voice, a few of your people could handle that security system.
Send a couple of Esh-kha.
Our blood will paint our footsteps, but we shall.
An ocean can breathe a few drops.
Gaden-Ko, it would only take a few commandos to disable security.
We can spare some commandos.
A few can walk.
I will instruct.
Blue Team will have all the protection they require.
I'll defend the Blue Team.
Does your intuition suggest where I'll be needed most?
Whose need is greater?
Defend Blue Team.
Red Team will have my lightsaber.
I'll fight with the Red Team.
Let's send your commandos.
That's a job for droids.
We need someone tech-minded.
Can you do an aerial strike?
